Name: Sail Day, Captain!
QuestDesc:
You find yourself caught in a gamble between Brant and the crew, and before you can protest, the title of one-day captain of the Fool's Troupe is thrust upon you.
Are you ready, Captain? Adventure awaits!

Chapters.Title: Talk to Brant in the Fool's Elysium

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only a six-pack? That's unlike you, Battier!

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk, this isn't just any drink. I brought the finest brew from Egla Town! Cost me a pretty penny, you know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye! Battier, my good friend, add one more six-pack. Tonight, this deck will be riotous with our revelry!

Options.PlotLineKey: What are you doing here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah! Look who decided to join us. You've come at the perfect moment, {PlayerName}. We're about to place a very, very important bet.

Options.PlotLineKey: What's the bet?
You do realize your luck isn't good, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Budd
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're betting on who will catch the first fish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey now, grant this captain his due! I'm working hard to secure some fine libations for us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Battier fancies himself my rival, so he's wagering his prized stash of wheat liquor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Believe me, that stuff from Egla Town is pure heaven—smooth, sweet… I can almost taste it already.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Confident, are we? Let's sweeten the stakes. I'll toss in a bottle of Troupe Strength. Everyone's in for some fine spoils tonight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! A bold move, Battier! Let's make this really interesting. What would you have me wager?

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh no, Captain, we're not just betting drinks today. Not with {PlayerName} as our guest!

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about this? If I win, you give the crew a day off. We all want to hang out with the Carnevale's Laureate again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you, Captain, will handle all the chores. Cooking, cleaning, deck scrubbing—the whole kit and caboodle!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Brant and Battier heatedly discuss the stakes, you notice the fishing rod twitching, the line pulling tight—

Options.PlotLineKey: The rod! Reel it in!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Neither Brant nor Battier pays you any mind, completely absorbed in their wager. Their focus is so intense that even the Primus himself would be made to wait until the bet is settled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deal! It's been too long since I last cooked for the crew. If I lose, I'll show you all what this captain can whip up in the galley!

Options.PlotLineKey: (Reel in the fishing rod.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The weight tugs heavily—this is no small catch. It must be sizeable enough to decide the outcome of the bet in one swift motion. You reel it in...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And there it is! A colossal fish, flopping in the air with a look of sheer disbelief in its eyes. Well, fishy friend, bid goodbye to the water and say hello to dry land!

Dialogues.Speaker: Sithos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the Sentinel, look at the size of that beast!

Dialogues.Speaker: Budd
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do we even have a pot big enough to cook it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait a minute... isn't that Battier's rod?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, well, I didn't see that coming! But I do relish a good twist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's that, the Fish King himself? Well done, my friend! And congrats, Captain, you've just won yourself a day full of chores, haha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well, a bet's a bet. Looks like I'm a humble sailor today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're playing sailor, then who's gonna be our captain?

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who do you think?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feast your eyes on that great fish {Male=he;Female=she} caught! I'd say our Laureate is more than qualified to steer this ship!

Options.PlotLineKey: Me? A captain? You must be joking.
I'll be whatever you want, provided I'm compensated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've got no doubt you'd make a great captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Absolutely, my friend. We sail straight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But no pressure, of course. It's entirely up to you whether you wish to take command.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Setting that aside, why not join us for dinner? Trust me, you won't want to miss the liquor you won for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Allow us to thank you properly for all the help you've given. So, what say you? Will you honor us with your presence?

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must! And with that beast of a fish you just hauled in, tonight's feast will be unforgettable. Come, fill your belly. It's the least you deserve!

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right then, I'm off to let the kitchen know what's coming and to dig up my finest liquor for the occasion!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I'll be excusing myself as well, Captain. Ah, time to scrub the decks until they shine like gold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and if you find yourself with nothing to do, feel free to explore. Make yourself feel right at home on this ship! Ciao!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You find yourself stumbling into Brant and Battier's bet. Just as they get into a heated debate, you manage to catch the winning King Fish.
Now, you've become the Captain of the Day for the troupe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, Captain, how about it? Fancy a wager on who hooks the first fish?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A bet to start the day? Oh, Battier, you do know how to charm a man.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are we betting?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that Brant...? What are those two doing? Better find out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's still time before dinner! Smiles are all around. Why not wander about and soak it all in?

Options.PlotLineKey: About this captain thing…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Battier did say the winner would be the captain, but of course, the choice is yours. So, do you want the helm?

Options.PlotLineKey: What does being captain actually involve?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Simply put, you chart the course and steer the ship. The crew will be ready to sail on your order at a moment's notice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Might seem easy enough, but there's more to being captain of the Troupe of Fools.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These seas are full of thrilling quests and glittering treasures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's where a true captain shines! Leading their crew to uncover lost legends, revel in the crowd's cheers, and sail boldly through the Stormy Sea toward glory.

Options.PlotLineKey: That does get me going.
Sounds easier said than done.
I feel like there are easier ways to find glory...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's true. But you know the greatest legends are forged in the fiercest storms.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: True, but every drop of sweat brings laughter, and every adventure leads to a chest full of treasure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But none of this is possible without a captain, and the same goes for every member of the troupe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take Battier, for example, he's our best fisherman. Tina? She knows every inch of the sea. And Lavito's stories could stretch on to fill a hundred nights.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone's unique talents make this troupe what it is. Each soul plays an important role.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, but duty calls, Captain. Oh, time to scrub the decks before dinner, as promised.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dinner's at six. Good... there's still time. Until then!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... What does the captain of the Troupe of Fools do in a day?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's still some time before dinner. Might as well see what the crewmates are doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave the paperwork to Brant. It's part of his responsibilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Returned sailed through scorching flames, back to the stage's brilliant light… "Hoist the jib and set sail," he cried. "We shall conquer the raging sea..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Pan Cake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Six o'clock, dinner! Six o'clock, dinner!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's still some time before dinner. A little stroll could be a good idea.

Chapters.Title: Go have dinner with the Troupe from 18:00 to 23:00

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, {PlayerName}. I heard you're the captain today. Don't forget to wrap up the paperwork!

Options.PlotLineKey: I thought I was running a ship, not a ledger!
I came for the high seas, not a list of to-dos!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, don't worry. It was a joke. I hope you've been enjoying yourself today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave the paperwork to Brant. Pero will keep an eye on him to make sure it's done by tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brant might not look like your typical captain, but he gets the job done.

Options.PlotLineKey: He is surprisingly reliable.
He does things in his style.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, all in a day's work for a captain, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain {PlayerName}, what's our destination?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Normally, Captain Brant calls the shots, but since the helm is yours, I'm all ears!

Options.PlotLineKey: Finally! Now this feels like a captain's job.
I'll leave it to the First Mate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fools are always eager to know where we're headed. So a captain must light the way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The First Mate's opinion does matter, but it's up to the captain to set the course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For those of us who've left our pasts behind, a guiding star is everything. I don't know what the troupe would do without a captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I see. I'll do my best to live up to that! Then, let us—)

Options.PlotLineKey: Explore the entirety of Rinascita!
Sail back to Huanglong!
Visit the Black Shores!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Splendid! Brant took us to Septimont once, so we know that route well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That might be a challenge. We've never gone that far before, but I've heard about Huanglong's famed Hero Plays. Maybe we'll get to see one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores…? I've never heard of that place. What's it like? Can't wait to see it for myself!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that I know the plan, I'll go tell the others and get things ready.

Options.PlotLineKey: No gasps of disbelief?
Just another day in the life of the Troupe of Fools!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha! We've braved wuthering waves and stared down every tide! We're seasoned sailors, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain Brant might be whimsical at times, but when the chips are down, he always pulls everyone through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Surprises are just part of our life, so we've gotten used to this "improvised" way of sailing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, we've been busy with convoy assignments lately as pirates have been causing trouble intercepting trade routes, so we should stay sharp, Captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After today's performance, I'll check the sea conditions again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tina! Where are you? Rehearsal is starting soon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm coming!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, Captain, duty calls! I hope you're finding your footing here. Catch you later!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pan Cake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Six o'clock, dinner! Six o'clock, dinner!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pan Cake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings! Captain Brant sends his regards!

Options.PlotLineKey: Brant lost his bet.
I'm the captain now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pan Cake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ooh, Captain! Captain!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pan Cake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brant lost again! Surprise, surprise.

Options.PlotLineKey: It happens a lot, doesn't it?
Has he ever won?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pan Cake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never wins! Never wins!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pan Cake
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain, Pan Cake at your service! At your service!

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Returned sailed through scorching flames, back to the stage's brilliant light… "Hoist the jib and set sail," he cried. "We shall conquer the raging sea..."

Options.PlotLineKey: What's that you're singing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, just a little shanty about a tale on the tip of everyone's tongue lately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say a pirate roams the Stormy Sea—an immortal who can walk through fire without a scratch. No one has ever caught him.

Options.PlotLineKey: Got a name for him?
Sounds like a real mystery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, the name's not important. It's just a story, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know how it is—stories tend to pick up a little extra color as they're passed around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, the children love this sort of thing. Stories and songs, all woven together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're always asking Captain Brant to sing with them. He gets into it too—sometimes he makes up a whole scene right on the spot.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is that part of the captain's duties?

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not quite. Just Brant indulging his whims.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I'd better get back to composing. I want to have this new song ready for those young buccaneers by dinner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A bottle of Troupe Strength, just for you! Around these parts, this stuff is as good as gold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and look what I found while gutting the fish!

Options.PlotLineKey: Let me see.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's… split in half?

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Odd, right? Found it just like this. It might even be a relic from the old days.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, there's something there…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May I have a look?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that a letter? Does it mean anything to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, yes. On these seas, there is only one legend about "D."

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The story of Drake, the Golden Captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain Drake! That adventurer everyone talks about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought that was just a fanciful story…

Options.PlotLineKey: Who is Captain Drake?
What do they say about him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain Drake, the famed hero of Rinascita. Legend has it he assembled a crew with naught but a single coin and amassed great riches from the wealthiest of men.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He then embarked on a quest to chart a safe passage across the Stormy Sea. A feat worthy of being remembered forever!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But there was a price. Only one crew member returned, and he had been driven mad. What happened out there is still a mystery.

Options.PlotLineKey: You seem to know the story well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such tales were my bedtime stories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back when I just boarded the Pilgrim's Sail, with no family and nightmares that could raise the dead, Toscanini would share such stories to comfort me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the time, I swore that if I ever became a captain, every crew member would come back safe. No exceptions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, Toscanini, the Night Watcher. Hahaha. You're one of the few who still remembers him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did he ever tell you the rest? That mad sailor who raved about his captain's coin, saying it would lead to untold treasures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps it's the very coin our Captain here is holding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Untold treasures, eh? Well, aren't we lucky. If we had the whole thing, imagine the riches we'd claim...

Options.PlotLineKey: Do these treasures really exist?
Any idea where the other half of the coin might be hiding？

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, they exist, alright. The Golden Captain conquered every sea known to man. The wealth he amassed could give us all lives of leisure and luxury.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You raise a fine point. Where is the other half…

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Half a coin… Treasures… Blast!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something wrong, Hymer?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that I think of it… I lost a half-coin just like this not long ago.

Options.PlotLineKey: You sure? One like this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, almost identical! There was a man yapping about its value. I thought he was just bluffing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't take him seriously... then I lost it to Bella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bella… Since the pirates started stirring the waters around Ragunna, she's been hiring us to guard her family ships.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye! She's a regular at Trattoria Margherita. Loves their pizzas. I run into her all the time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then, our next stop is clear. Fortune has a way of smiling on us, Captain. Shall we try our luck at the restaurant?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What say you? Ready to check it out?

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't have to ask me twice.
Sailor Brant, lead the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye, aye, Captain! Our course is set! Ready the sails, and let the wind carry us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
While having dinner, Battier hands you half of a lucky coin.
Brant recognizes that it belongs to the legendary adventurer, Captain Drake, which may lead to treasures beyond imagination.
A troupe member, Hymer, shares information on the other half's whereabouts. You and Brant set off on its search.

Chapters.Title: Go look for Bella at Margherita Restaurant

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There she is. It's rare to see her drinking alone… Let's go talk to her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bella, my friend! Why so down? It's not like you to drink alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... spare me the pleasantries. My luck has taken a turn lately. Nothing seems to be going my way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pirates are strangling our shipping routes, and if that weren't enough—look at this pizza! No olives!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Margherita says they're out for a few days. Can you believe it? Even the simplest pleasures conspire against me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that lucky coin I fought tooth and nail to get? Stolen! Some wretched thief made off with it. I've been cursed ever since.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unlike you, Brant. You could disappear into a fog and emerge glittering like a diamond. If only I could borrow just a pinch of your luck…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry to hear that, Bella, but I've got news for you: I'm not the captain today. If you need good luck, you'll have to ask this one here.

Options.PlotLineKey: It might surprise you to learn that Brant lost a bet.
Sorry to disappoint, but I'm the captain today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I lost a bet, fair and square. Now I'm but a humble deckhand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You never know what the tides will bring, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Margherita, two glasses of Nectarwine please, and top off Bella's drink. On my tab.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Coming right up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No luck charm beats a good glass of Gocce di Divino. Cheers to shaking off that bad luck!

Options.PlotLineKey: Cheers!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Cheers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The three of you raise your glasses in unison and down the drink. To hell with bad luck and cheers to a great, memorable night!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, that's fine wine. By the way, Bella, where exactly did that coin of yours get stolen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right here, in the restaurant. A few days ago, I placed it on the table while I was chatting. Next thing I know, poof, it vanished.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A lot of diners have been losing things lately… I can't say who's behind it, but it seems to be happening more frequently...

Options.PlotLineKey: Sounds like a common thief.
Seems they've set their sights on this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, a common thief… Captain, I have a plan, but I'll need you to steer the ship this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Oh, really? I've only just started on mine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Gulping)

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ALL EYES ON ME! I, Brant of the Troupe of Fools, have a grand announcement to make!

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Female Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's happening here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this supposed to be part of their show?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Friends, gather 'round! Have you ever heard of the legend of the lucky coin?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A coin said to guide its owner to untold riches and hidden treasures buried deep beneath the Stormy Sea!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My friend is fortunate enough to have half of this coin, so we set out to find the other half.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fog tried to lead us astray and raging tides sought to hold us back, but we did not yield! The coin's magic has led us here, and now we seek to reunite it with its missing piece!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, ladies and gentlemen! If any among you holds a clue to the whereabouts of the other half of this coin, step forward now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Share with us the secret, and fortune shall be shared in return!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You come across Bella and inquire her about the coin.
The noblewoman with an odd obsession with good luck charms grudgingly reveals a sad truth: The coin has been stolen. Brant, known for being theatrical, applies his way of responding to the circumstances. Through his unique approach, he attracts everyone's attention and shares the story of the lucky coin!
Time to join in that act with Brant and dig out that lucky person.

Chapters.Title: Look for suspicious people in the crowd

Dialogues.Speaker: Hesitant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should I tell them...? A share of the treasures would be nice, but…

Options.PlotLineKey: Hello there. Any clue about that coin, by chance?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hesitant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Me? No, no… I've got nothing for you.

Options.PlotLineKey: What a shame. That means you'll have to miss out on those treasures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hesitant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright… Maybe I do know a thing or two…

Options.PlotLineKey: Just a simple yes or no will do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hesitant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Damn it! Oh, fine! I know where the other half is, but you'll have to cough up some payment first.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How am I supposed to know you're not lying just to pocket the reward?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hesitant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not lying! If that rotten pirate hadn't stolen it from me, I'd still have the coin with me now!

Options.PlotLineKey: Oh, there you are, you thief.
(Grab him.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Hesitant Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before he can react, you dash forward and pin him down.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Ah... Brant is playing the crowd. Heh, a clever move.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (With all eyes on him, this is my chance to look for any unusual behavior.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain, now I'm getting confused…

Options.PlotLineKey: Who else was around when you lost the coin?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Um, well, er, Margherita, Constantine, and…

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! There was a gentleman who asked me for directions.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you remember what he looked like?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No… It was utter chaos at the time. I really wasn't paying attention. Ugh, this is frustrating…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then! My friend drove the harpoon deep into the fish, the line snapped taut, pulling us down, nearly dragging us overboard. Just then, we heard the haunting song of the sirens weaving through the thick fog…

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my Sentinel! What happened next?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not even the dangerous fog or those eerie melodies could rattle my friend's resolve! Instead, {Male=he;Female=she} leaped onto the back of that monstrous fish and led us out of danger, as bold as a lion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was as if the Sentinel, impressed by our courage, rewarded us with this—a half coin, nestled deep in that fish's belly.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (He's really in his element. I should find a time to introduce him to Encore...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the matter with him?! Is he drunk?

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. It's all an act.
Someone's had one drink too many.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh heh! Just acting, aye? Well, that's a good laugh!

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At least he likes our liquor enough to make a scene out of it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what's this "lucky coin" he's jabberin' about? Is it really that special? I can hardly believe something so valuable might be sitting right here in my wee restaurant!

Options.PlotLineKey: Have you noticed anyone acting strange recently?
Have you ever seen a coin like this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm… now that you mention it, there's a regular who takes a right odd stroll around the place before sitting down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, can't say I have. But I have a regular who's got a habit of taking a right odd stroll around the place before sitting down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's got a habit of claiming a seat in the corner… Maybe he knows something?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How was my improvised performance, Cap? No applause or cheers for your humble bard?

Options.PlotLineKey: Bravo! Bravo!
I thought you were drunk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you! Thank you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was a wonderful performance!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To be honest, I came dangerously close to it…

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take care not to overindulge again. We don't offer home delivery for humans, I assure you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, seems like we've got ourselves a lucky gentleman.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about an introduction first, and then you tell us where that coin is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Swiper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Name's Swiper. Go ahead, gloat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Swiper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chalk it up to a bit of lousy luck. You lot would never have caught me otherwise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Swiper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the coin you're after? It's long gone. I barely had it before pirates backed me into a corner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pirates?

Dialogues.Speaker: Swiper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, their captain, name's something like Aldric. He took one look at that blasted coin, started muttering something about a midnight rendezvous in ugh... Egla. Whatever they're planning, I don't like the sound of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aldric… so it is him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Swiper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's all I know! If you want the coin, go catch him yourself. Now let me go! I'm innocent!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Innocent? You stole the coin from me, and now you dare claim innocence?

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despicable! After all you've done to our customers, you show no remorse. You're off to the Order Tribunal for judgment!

Dialogues.Speaker: Swiper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order Tribunal…? Hey, you can't do this to me! I told you where the coin is! You owe me for that information!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! And your payment will be a one-way trip to the Order Tribunal. May you start a fresh chapter there, my friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Move! I'm taking you to the Tribunal. You'll be coughing up every single thing you've stolen, and then some!

Options.PlotLineKey: Seems like you know who this Aldric is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An old acquaintance of mine, so to speak. We were banished on the Pilgrim's Sail together. I remember he even had a nickname—Quickfoot Aldric.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But he always had trouble embracing our ideals, so he left the troupe before long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next time we saw him, he had already become a pirate.

Options.PlotLineKey: So he was once part of the Troupe of Fools.
Hard to believe he's chosen to side against the Troupe of Fools.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's probably after Drake's treasures as well, which explains why he took the coin from Swiper.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Makes sense. But what's got him heading to Egla Town at midnight?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, that's the part we'll need to see for ourselves.

Options.PlotLineKey: Then our course is set once again.
Let's go see for ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like we'll be burning the midnight oil. Once we arrive, we'd better keep an eye out for those plushies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You make quick work of the thief and pin him down. According to your lucky gentleman, the coin was taken by a pirate named Aldric.
You also learn that this pirate is planning something big at Egla Town at midnight tonight.
That doesn't sound good! Better find out what he's up to quickly, Captain!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain, look over there…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like they're preparing for a grand gathering.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As much as I'd love to go over and stoke the fires of their fun...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those pirates are on high alert. If our approach is clumsy, we may as well shout "Hello! We're here to ruin your party!"

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Agreed. We need to gather intel without being spotted. Let's find a way to sneak past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly what I was thinking. See those Echoes over there?

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you have a plan?
Why do I feel you're about to do something stupid…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, as the saying goes, "At sea, abide by the waves; on land, respect the earth."

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is a <ano=Echoes>plushie</ano> gathering, so we'd better fit in with their customs!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, Captain! The night has cast its spell, and it's time for the plushies to dance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's welcome the superstars of tonight's Plushie Gathering—Cuddle Wuddle and Lottie Lost!

Options.PlotLineKey: Hi, I'm Cuddle Wuddle.
Wait? Why are you a Lottie Lost?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I'm Lottie Lost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because a troupe can only have one Cuddle Wuddle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, let's go give Aldric a surprise he won't forget!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Brant find yourselves bumping into a grand gathering right in the middle of Egla Town.
As much as you'd love to stoke some fires, it's best to keep a low profile and avoid alerting the pirates.
But worry not, Brant has come up with a wonderful plan as he puts something on you, and just like that, you've transformed into the superstars of tonight's Plushie Gathering, Cuddle Wuddle and Lottie Lost!
Look out, Aldric, a surprise is coming your way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stammering Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ca-captain, wh-why are you just standing there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's what you're here for, isn't it? Charge, go on! Once the treasure is ours, we'll feast and drink like true nobility!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stammering Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fl-flame!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Flame? What flame? Stop blithering about and hold your ground! This blasted coin is still as useful as a chocolate teapot…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Flame, you say? Let me turn this into a bonfire!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: KILL THEM!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pirate Crowd
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All yours, Captain!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aldric fled like a cat with its tail on fire. Still living up to his old nickname, Quickfoot.

Options.PlotLineKey: I would've liked to catch him.
At least we saved those innocent Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Captain. I've got a feeling our paths will cross again soon enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed, and we reclaimed this half-coin. And next time we're in Ragunna, we'll return it to Bella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've got a feeling we'll cross paths with Aldric again soon enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Unsad Lottie Lost
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lottie… Lost!

Options.PlotLineKey: I can tell she's happier now.
She's saying "Bravo!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, would you look at that. Captain, I didn't know you were fluent in Echo!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss, as promised, you and your friends can now dance in the moonlight to your heart's content. Go on, enjoy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems Aldric spent too much time on the sea and forgot the fundamental rule of this trade: quid pro quo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you want the sea's rewards, you have to give something in return. Just like how being a captain doesn't just come with rights, but duties too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every reward has its price, and tricking his men into paying it for his own gain is absolutely unforgivable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, take a look at this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This map marks three isles. I'm betting they're the hiding places for Drake's treasure.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you have wishes you want to fulfill?
Are you after Drake's treasures, too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, well, who could resist the siren call of Drake's fabled riches? It's tempting, no doubt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But truth be told, it's not the treasures themselves that draw me in. It's the stories—the legend of Drake himself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What did he face? What mysteries did he leave behind? There's no grander performance than that, Captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've come this far already. I'd regret it forever if I turned back now. So yes, I want to visit those isles, and maybe we can uncover the truth about Drake's treasures.

Options.PlotLineKey: But we'll need a ship.
What if we run into more pirates?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, that's exactly what I was thinking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pirates? No big deal. We'll deal with them like we always do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Luckily for us, one of our troupe's Gondolas has been docked since the Carnevale. Looks like it'll come in handy after all.

Options.PlotLineKey: Time's ticking. Let's go.
I'm ready to take the wheel this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Off we go! I'll lead the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Having lost the coin to you, Aldric makes a break for it amidst the chaos.
You finally have the map. To the treasure!
There's a troupe Gondola docked at the passenger port. Time to give the steering some spin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here we are, Captain—the port. See that Gondola over there? That's ours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sometimes, we set up a temporary stage on it for impromptu performances. Keeps things lively.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've sent the coordinates of the first isle to your Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, all we need to do is sail full speed ahead toward our destination!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're nearing the dock. Let's head in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's so quiet... like an intermission.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whenever it gets this still, I can't help but anticipate the next act and the surprises it might bring.

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain was right! They're here! Everyone, get 'em!

Options.PlotLineKey: That's the "surprise" you were waiting for.
Get ready for a brawl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Argh! We can't win! RUN! Run for your lives!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've seen more fight in a children's theater troupe. Anyway, looks like they were digging over there. Let's take a look.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here it is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It looks like a chunk of amber. Its color is quite beautiful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember the Amber Key Aldric mentioned before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This must be it. Let's take it and head to the next isle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... something feels off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, now that was a surprise. Aren't we lucky?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's nothing else in this hole.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure there is—my trusty shovel and some air.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright. No more jokes. Keep digging, Captain!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't wait to see what surprises the second isle has in store.

Chapters.Title: Head to the second isle on your Gondola

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wonderful, gentlemen! At last, I've found the key! O-of course, your help has been invaluable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you see those wrecked ships? And with this thick fog... This place is danger incarnate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, as your captain, I'm willing to sacrifice myself, braving all the dangers ahead, for our grand cause!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stay here and await my return. And if anyone dares to get in our way, make them rue the day!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stammering Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain! Oh, captain!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …That's Aldric's voice.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like the fog is rolling in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. This happens often when you're out at sea. Just trust the wheel in your hands and trust me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Follow their lights, Captain, and we'll safely reach our destination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As if to chase away any worries, Brant hums softly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at those shipwrecks, Captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are those... Drake's ships?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. It's said that Drake's fleet sailed across the entire Stormy Sea. Hard to believe that such a legendary figure could lose his way...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if these wrecks are here, it means we're nearing our destination!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, you two! Stop right there!

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you talking to us?
We're just passing by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! You two.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nonsense! My eyes tell me you're not just passing by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain's orders are crystal clear: No one messes with our grand cause. No one's stopping me from soaking in wine and him from decking his teeth in gold!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stammering Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Th-that's right! Y-you know how badly my teeth ache now… Owww…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, let us show you what real pirates are made of!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You run into Aldric's underlings, but they don't seem to be in a talking mood. All they care about is showing you what pirates are made of.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stammering Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-wait! We're in trouble… It's the f-f…

Dialogues.Speaker: Stammering Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Flaming Returned!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What!? Why didn't you say so earlier?! We surrender! We surrender!

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, we yield.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't expect you to be the Flaming Returned, the legendary pirate who can't die… We don't stand a chance.

Options.PlotLineKey: What's this, another new dramatic backstory?
So your secret identity is a notorious pirate?
Any more absurd titles you want to tell me about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You think so too, huh? Throwing in random plot twists like this will only confuse the audience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha, so this is my hidden identity!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just as curious as you are. With any luck, it'll be a catchy one for my next performance on stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stop playing coy! You know what I'm on about! It's a tale every sailor has heard!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After finding out that Brant is the Flaming Returned, the pirates immediately surrender.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one knows when he appeared

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or when he vanished…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He was hunted time and again

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But slipped through every noose

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say he's immortal, for no raging storm—

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Character_Brant_52_32

Options.PlotLineKey: Character_Brant_52_22
Character_Brant_52_23

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Character_Brant_52_33

Options.PlotLineKey: Character_Brant_52_25
Character_Brant_52_26

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nor crashing wave

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not even the sharpest blade can kill him!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's quite the legend you've built yourself

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha… Let's see how this plays out

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strong as hell, that one was

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Character_Brant_52_34

Options.PlotLineKey: Character_Brant_52_28
Character_Brant_52_29

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Had the guts to raid the Pilgrim's Sails again and again

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rescue missions!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He always ruined our plans!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every time we set off to raid those merchant ships

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This fiery bastard would swoop in, flames blazing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stammering Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-b-beyond outrageous!

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now you know why we chose to surrender…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, right. I am the Flaming Returned, the immortal scourge of the seas. Cross me, and you'll be haunted by the crackle of flames every night!

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gold, for the love of gold, don't! I'll spill everything!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stammering Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-but, wouldn't that be betraying our captain?

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fool! Didn't you hear the captain? "If anyone dares to get in our way, make 'em regret it!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we don't give 'em what they want, Captain won't sleep a wink. He'll be plagued with nightmares of this menace!

Dialogues.Speaker: Uncocky Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, Captain's already off with the key we found. He promised to share the loot with us, and soon I'll be swimming in barrels of wine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stammering Pirate
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A-and I can get a gold tooth...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, what a generous captain you serve… truly selfless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And yet somehow, these two were left behind to stop us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then, let's head to the next isle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The pirates reveal Aldric's next destination to you.
Time to pay him a visit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, we're nearly there at last.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm very excited. There's something magical about the end of a journey, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's when the real excitement kicks in, just before the final curtain call.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, Captain… ready for what comes next?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's Aldric. Right there, just as we thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brant. I didn't think you'd show up so soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I didn't think you'd still be here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm… where's all that treasure, then? Your crew is itching for the grand return of their selfless, heroic Captain Aldric.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Useless fools. Couldn't even slow you down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine, you want the key, don't you? I could give it to you, but—

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I see! You want an honorable duel with my captain? A proper sea knight's duel, full of valor and—

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, no! Must we always resort t-to violence? See that? It takes two keys to unlock!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have one, and I have the other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We both want the treasures, right? So how about this, I'll give you my key, but we split the treasure. Sixty-forty… No, wait, I-I'll be generous. You take the sixty, and I'll settle for forty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've seen my crew. Those poor souls… I'm doing this for them, to give them the life they deserve. A-a happy, peaceful life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you say, Captain of the Troupe of Fools? A fair deal, wouldn't you agree?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (He sounds sincere. Can I really trust him?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Regardless, agreeing to his deal to get ahold of the other key is in my best interest. Even if it's a trap, we can handle it. In that case...)

Options.PlotLineKey: (Agree with his proposal.)
(Think about it for a bit longer.)
(Look at Brant.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deal. Hand over the key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, we don't have all day! Make a decision, or none of us will get the treasure!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deal. Hand over the key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, we accept. Hand over the key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here you go. The gate's right over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to claim our treasures... Wait! What's that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahhhh! You, uh, stay here and defend our great cause! Show them the true might of the Fool's Troupe. FAREWELL!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Aldric suggests a truce and a partnership, where he'll hand you the key under a 60/40 split in your favor once the treasure is found.
You agree to this partnership while also keeping a close eye on him. You're well prepared by the time he goes back on his words and makes his move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, the gate's closed. Looks like our friend left us with these two Chop Chops for company.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just what you'd expect from a pirate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's an opening over there. Let's check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah! I knew there'd be a way forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's keep moving.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that a picture?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's badly eroded. Let's take a closer look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find distinct carvings, though much has been worn away by time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Let me out… That's why I wanna leave…"

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Someone was once trapped here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find more carvings, but most are illegible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "No... hope. I pray for this to end… Ghh…"

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lost by seafarers, no doubt. Likely got caught in the sea fog and couldn't find their way out, poor boys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like... he's a captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's got a scale in one hand and... wait, that coin in his other hand, it looks just like the one we found.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One side holds treasure, and the other… a broken heart. What do you think it means, Captain?

Options.PlotLineKey: It's hinting at how to get the treasure.
It's a warning to be cautious.
Art isn't really my forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm… so you're saying we may need to trade something precious, like our heart, for the treasure?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could be. In stories like these, there's always a catch. Treasure hoarders love setting traps for any would-be thieves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No worries. We might find more clues ahead to piece it together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, there are stories about a place at the edge of the ocean, a nation where people use scales to measure everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Souls, wealth... nothing escapes the balance. Perhaps this painting nods to that—everything has a price. Classic quid pro quo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fascinating, isn't it? Maybe even Drake had a sense of fairness when it came to treasure. Anyway, let's keep moving, Captain. I have a hunch we'll uncover more soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It says…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Oh sea, curse equally all who dare to steal the treasure!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Remember the law of quid pro quo. Remember the law of quid pro quo…"

Options.PlotLineKey: Curse all who steal the treasure?
Remember the law of quid pro quo?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like to claim Drake's treasure, one must pay a price equal to its worth. Maybe that's why no one's succeeded.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The treasure demands something in return.

Options.PlotLineKey: The golden rule…
Every reward comes with a price.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. If we want something from the sea, we have to offer something in return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ignore that rule, and greed will swallow us whole. Likely with our lives as the main course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain, I know what we need to do. Do you trust me?

Options.PlotLineKey: Do what you have to do.
Your captain is right by your side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's all I needed to hear. Let's head for the treasure!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find more carvings. They are hard to read, but you can make out a few sentences.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Curses await ahead…"

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "They lost their minds at the sight of the treasures, fighting like madmen. It was terrifying..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Curses, huh? I guess that's why no one's ever managed to bring back Drake's treasures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wh-what's happening?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Curse… This is the curse! My gold… My gold is moving!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No Aldric, this is the price of your greed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you forget? "The law of quid pro quo."

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean that blasted half-coin?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You toss a Shell Credit into the air, a flicker of hope rising within you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You hear no response, only the sound of waves crashing against the shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, my dear friends! What a joy to see you both in one piece!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I was absolutely quaking back there. Just the thought of that <ano=Chop Chop>monster</ano>… it still gives me the shivers!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I finally came to my senses, I found myself here, all alone. Quite... quite unsettling, I must say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But look at you! You took down that beast faster than I could blink.

Options.PlotLineKey: Still working on that "grand cause" of yours?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grand…? Oh yes! My grand cause! I'm this close to realizing it, you see. Look! Drake's treasure is right there, so brilliant, so-so dazzling…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as a man of principle, I could never hoard such wealth all to myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, in the spirit of fairness, I'd like to give you the honor of opening it first. Please go ahead, the first pick is yours!

Options.PlotLineKey: Leave your bluster at the door.
You're just afraid of the curse, aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: C-curse? Hahaha! Do I look like the kind of man who fears mere legends? No, no, my offer comes straight from the heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In accordance with the law of the sea…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is just a teeny tiny curse. Nothing more, nothing less.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... you look fine…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahahaha! Curse? Turns out it's as harmless as a kitten!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I fretted for nothing! Yes, now all this treasure is MINE!

Options.PlotLineKey: What about your grand cause?
What about your crew?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grand cause? My crew? Oh right…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll toss a modest pouch to each of my loyal mateys, and the rest? ALL MINE! Hahaha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I left the Pilgrim's Sail, there was only one thing that stayed with me—to chase my desires without chains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And after all these years, I've cracked the code… Money! Hahaha! That's my one true calling. Hahaha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But everything comes with a price, Aldric.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now, it's time to pay yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wh-what?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out, Captain!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You reach the treasure's location and meet Aldric once again.
Aldric plays his old trick, trying to fool you into doing all the hard work of getting the treasure.
Just as Brant uses the coin to obtain the nautical chart, Aldric snatches the chest, declaring he wants all the treasure for himself. Sure, he's free to claim the treasure for himself, but such freedom always comes with a price.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The gold… My gold…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aldric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Treasure… My grand cause… No…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We managed to slip away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I… I never thought he'd pick those treasures over his own life…

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you holding up alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then… When Toscanini first told us about Drake's story, I said I wanted to be a captain who led the crew to countless triumphs so that everyone gets to carve out their own destiny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aldric just laughed, calling it foolish. He said, "You fool! With Drake's treasure, you can crush anyone and make everyone's life better by force!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never bought into that. For me, it's not about riches or power. It's about freedom—the freedom to sail your own course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why we parted ways. He left the Troupe of Fools and became a pirate.

Options.PlotLineKey: The two of you became very different captains.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Amidst all your theatrics, you always remain true to your code.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a captain, you're quite different yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Certainly one I'd be proud to follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You accept your crew for who they are, understanding and respecting their choices.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've had my share of adventures, but I must admit—this one with you has been a breath of fresh air.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, look at this.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is this... Drake's treasure?
What? It looks like an ordinary scroll.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Golden Captain Drake's map, a record of his life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to this, he and his crew did indeed brave the treacherous Stormy Sea and return with immense wealth, but not without paying dearly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heavy fog, disease, getting hopelessly lost, each entry could have sunk an entire fleet. By the time they made it back to the isle, only a handful survived.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most of them never left. In the end, only one sailor remained with this coin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember what that note said? "Remember the law of quid pro quo."

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe it means if you want Drake's treasure, you have to offer something in return. The price I paid for this scroll was that coin.

Options.PlotLineKey: So, you gave away the coin…
And got this scroll in return?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, but isn't it fascinating? A single coin can lead to both dreadful curses and priceless treasures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who would have guessed that Drake's most valuable treasure would be a map worth just one coin?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honestly, when I made the trade, I wasn't sure what I'd get.

Options.PlotLineKey: You were betting on it?
That was quite the gamble.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha! I had faith in you, my friend, and the spirit of adventure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And this story is far more compelling than the saga of the Flaming Returned, don't you think?

Options.PlotLineKey: Didn't expect that title to come up again…
Tell me what all that is really about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, you remember those pirates who said I was always on the run?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every time a bounty was placed on my head, I'd work with my crew. They'd turn me in for the reward, and I'd handle the escape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rumors spread faster than I expected. Hahaha…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, if you're up for it, the trip back is long enough for me to tell you all about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, Captain, the adventure's come to a close. Ready to sail back home?

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After finally making it back to the gondola, Brant shares with you stories of the past, the present, and the nautical chart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, what a journey. It feels good to be back.

Options.PlotLineKey: Seems like my captaincy is over, too…
I'll leave the paperwork to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time really does fly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Paperwork? Why wasn't I warned about this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, jokes aside, you can count on me for that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, this is for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this… Drake's scroll?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly! I figured it would be a good memento of our adventure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and due to your stellar performance, I'm officially naming you our troupe's "Honorary Captain," as witnessed by this map!

Options.PlotLineKey: When do we sail again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That depends on when the next adventure calls! You know that I'll be ready to join you, just say the word.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As the adventure comes to an end, the troupe grants you the title of Honorary Captain.
Brant passes on Drake's nautical chart to you, insisting that if you ever come across new adventures in the future, remember to count him in the action.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm proud to announce that you are now our troupe's Honorary Captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whenever the next grand adventure calls, count me in. I'll be ready!
